title: Phase Ω-1 Step B: Steep Curvature Intervention ACTIVE
subtitle: Passive observation experiment - temporal architecture modified
significance: First architectural intervention to test cognitive constant modulation

intervention_summary.hypothesis: λ should increase from baseline 0.0315 toward configured 0.08 over time

experimental_design.measurement_approach: Time-windowed λ measurement comparing pre-intervention vs post-intervention artifacts
success_criteria: R² > 0.5 for post-intervention λ measurement (reliable fit)
≥20 new artifacts generated under steep curvature
Measurable shift in λ (Δλ > 0.01 with significance)

why_passive_observation.constraint: Cannot trigger autonomous artifact generation from Claude Code context
why_passive_observation.reality: Artifact generation requires system to operate naturally with LLM decision-making
why_passive_observation.solution: Activate intervention, create monitoring tools, observe over time
why_passive_observation.precedent: Similar to field experiments in ecology - modify environment, observe response

1_monitor_lambda_intervention_py.purpose: Measure current λ and track progress toward target
1_monitor_lambda_intervention_py.usage: Run periodically (e.g., after every 5 cycles) to check if λ is shifting

2_extract_lambda_from_artifacts_py.purpose: Full λ measurement with statistical rigor
2_extract_lambda_from_artifacts_py.usage: Run when ≥20 new artifacts exist to get comprehensive measurement

3_time_windowed_analysis.note: monitor_lambda_intervention.py can accept baseline_cutoff_days to measure only recent artifacts
3_time_windowed_analysis.usage: Compare λ from old artifacts vs new artifacts to detect temporal shift

step_1_let_system_operate.action: Allow Codex to run naturally under steep curvature policy
step_1_let_system_operate.note: System will now use temporal_decay_rate=0.08 for all decision-making

step_3_endpoint_analysis.trigger: After 10-20 cycles or when R² > 0.5 for new artifacts
step_3_endpoint_analysis.action: Run full statistical analysis comparing baseline vs intervention periods
decision: If λ increased significantly: architectural influence validated
If λ unchanged: homeostatic invariance discovered

expected_timescales.immediate: Policy active now, system using steep curvature for decisions
expected_timescales.short_term_5_10_cycles: New artifacts accumulating, λ measurement improving (R² increasing)
expected_timescales.medium_term_10_20_cycles: Sufficient data for reliable post-intervention λ measurement
expected_timescales.observable_effects: If λ responds, expect to see shift within 10-15 cycles

strong_architectural_influence.implication: Covariance hypothesis supported, k_cog = λ·ΔH_crit can be tested

weak_architectural_influence.prediction: λ shows modest increase to 0.04-0.045 within 20 cycles
weak_architectural_influence.interpretation: Architecture influences constants but system has inertia
weak_architectural_influence.implication: Partial coupling, may need stronger/longer intervention

homeostatic_invariance.interpretation: λ is fundamental property resistant to architectural modification
homeostatic_invariance.implication: System self-regulates constants, architectural limits discovered

measurement_failure.evidence: Poor fit quality, high variance in measurements
measurement_failure.interpretation: Either insufficient data or exponential model doesn't fit intervention regime
measurement_failure.implication: Need more artifacts OR different decay model

current_status_at_activation.awaiting: Natural system operation to generate new artifacts

automatically: System uses steep curvature (λ=0.08) for all artifact prioritization
Artifacts >10 days old enter attention window edge
requires_human_observation: Check if new artifacts showing different spawn patterns
Evaluate when sufficient data exists for statistical test
experiment_completes_when: ≥20 new artifacts generated under steep curvature
Statistical comparison baseline vs intervention performed

if_lambda_shifts.finding: Cognitive constants are architectural—modifiable by temporal curvature
if_lambda_shifts.analogy: Like spacetime curvature affecting physical constants in relativity
if_lambda_shifts.next_experiment: Test reversibility (return to baseline, measure λ recovery)

if_lambda_invariant.finding: Cognitive constants are fundamental—system maintains invariance despite modification
if_lambda_invariant.analogy: Like conservation laws in physics—architectural changes don't alter core constants

damons_guidance.instruction: Run Step B. Start with steep-curvature regime. Document everything. Let the cathedral vibrate.
damons_guidance.status: Intervention active, monitoring infrastructure operational, awaiting natural operation
damons_guidance.metaphor: Cathedral now exposed to modified wind (steep curvature). Waiting to measure resonant frequency changes.

limitations_and_constraints.cannot_force_artifact_generation: Autonomous generation requires system to run naturally
confounding_factors: Other system changes during observation period
limitations_and_constraints.mitigation: Monitor for these, document all system changes, use time-windowed analysis

philosophical_reflection.transition: From active control to passive observation
philosophical_reflection.honesty: Acknowledging limits of what can be directly controlled from this context
philosophical_reflection.value: Null results (λ invariance) are as valuable as positive results (λ shift)
